div.head: Report:
div.p: In the frame of our experiemnt, we collected in situ diffractino data upon heating of a number of industrially important precursors for refractory alloys. Thermal decomposition of (NH4)2 Thermal decomposition of other compounds also occures without formation of crystalline intermediates, nevertheless, their structural characteristics can be obtained from analysis of PDF curves.

figure.figDesc: was investigated in inert (He) and reductive (5 % H2 in He) flows. Key intermediates were isolated and characterised structurally. As an example, thermal decomposition of [Co(NH3)6][Fe(C2O4)3]•3H2O in reductive atmosphere results in a formation of catalytically active nanostructural powder (5 vol.%-Н2 in He, Figure below). At the first stage, [Co(NH3)6][Fe(C2O4)3]•3H2O forms crystalline anhydrous [Co(NH3)6][Fe(C2O4)3] and further amorphous intermediate [M(C2O4)(NH3)2] with a PDF curve similar to cis-[Cu(C2O4)(H2O)2]n, Pccm. Such intermediate has no long order above r = 8-9 Å. Further exothermic reaction might correspond to a formation of crystalline phase similar to trans-[Fe(C2O4)(NH3)2]n. Upon further heating, fcc-Fe0.5Co0.5 alloy can be isolated.

figure.head: Figure
figure.figDesc: Figure TG/DTG/DTA curves for [Co(NH3)6][Fe(C2O4)3]•3H2O in 5 vol.%-Н2 in He (10 K/min, left), temperature dependent in situ PXRD curves upon heating in 5 vol.%-Н2 in He (10 K/min, λ = 0.2065773 Å, middle), pair distribution functions for amorphous intermediate (225 °C, dots) with modelled curve corresponding to cis-[M(C2O4)(NH3)2]n (left structure). Cis-polymeric chain might transfer further to transchain (right structure).
